definitions: A foul-smelling, bitter-tasting gum resin obtained from the taproot of several species of Ferula, especially F. assa-foetida, of the parsley family, formerly used in medicine as an antispasmodic and carminative and now used as a flavoring in Indian cuisine.
examples: Asafoetida is often used in lentil dishes.
The distinct aroma of asafoetida can be quite strong.
